quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Symphony and Beethoven
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, wisconsin, maria. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer hit the pop charts with Its My Party and Ill Cry If I Want to and Now Its Judys Turn to Cry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leslie Gore

questions.question: Sherry was the first big hit of this group that featured four Jersey Boys.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Four Seasons

questions.question: This symphony by Beethoven was the first and last piece conducted by Leonard Bernstein with the Boston Symphony. The Philadelphia Orchestra used to perform the second movement at rehearsals whenever they heard of the death of a present or former orchestra member.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #7

questions.question: Running for 26 minutes, this symphony in F Major is the shortest of Beethovens symphonies and the only one without a dedication.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #8

questions.question: This singer was the only female member of The Fugees. She also acted in Sister Act II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lauryn Hill

questions.question: Concetta Rosa Maria Franconero, born in Newark, N.J., is better known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connie Francis

questions.question: This symphony by Beethoven is often called The Pastoral and was featured in the movies Fantasia and Soylent Green.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #6

questions.question: One of Beethovens most popular and famous works, this symphony was originally dedicated to Napoleon. When Napoleon accepted the title of Emperor of France, Beethoven changed the dedication to a heroic symphony, composed to celebrate the memory of a great man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #3

questions.question: She was called Sassy and was one of the greatest jazz vocalists.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Vaughan

questions.question: This great musician was born in Wisconsin but lived for many years in Mahwah, New Jersey. He is most responsible for the development of the unibody electric guitar. Unfortunately, he died in August of 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Les Paul

questions.question: This symphony, composed by Beethoven in 1800, lasts for just 28 minutes. Many say that it resembles a German drinking song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #1

questions.question: The great Choral Symphony by Beethoven ends with a beautiful song based on a German poem. Who wrote the poem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schiller

questions.question: Bruce Springsteen is from New Jersey. Can you name the two Jersey-born drummers for the E Street Band that periodically toured and recorded with Bruce Springsteen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vini Lopez and Max Weinberg

questions.question: The period from about 1812 to 1816 was one of Beethovens least productive periods. What is the most probable reason for this?

options.text: His parents both died during this period.
His Symphony #10 was a total failure.
He realized that he would never be able to marry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He realized that he would never be able to marry.

questions.question: This symphony was composed by Beethoven while he was at a health spa in Teplitz in Bohemia. It is Opus 92, in A -Major. Beethoven conducted it at its premiere at a concert to aide soldiers injured at the  Battle of Hanau, against Napoleons troops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony #7

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: New Jersey and Power
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, synanon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This former member of The Fugees was  born in Haiti, lived for a short time in Brooklyn, NY and then moved to New Jersey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wyclef Jean

questions.question: Ladies Night, Celebration, Get Down on It , Jungle Boogie and Fresh were hits for this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kool and the Gang

questions.question: Where in New Jersey was Frank Sinatra born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hoboken

questions.question: Although he is most often associated with Kansas City, this great band leader was born in New Jersey. Who is this jazz great whose big band was  featured in the last scene of the 1974 movie Blazing Saddles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Basie

questions.question: This famous drummer had a pop hit with Topsy Part 2. He played with Cab Calloway, The Louis Armstrong All Stars, and many other famous  jazz  orchestras.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cozy Cole

questions.question: This New Jersey group had big hits with Sylvias Mother, When Youre in Love with a Beautiful Woman and On the Cover of the Rolling Stone.

options.text: Dr. DeMento and the Medicine Show
Dr. Obama and the National Medicine Show
Dr. John and the Medicine Show
Dr. Hook and the Medicine Show

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Hook and the Medicine Show

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning movie featured Queens power ballad The Show Must Go On?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moulin Rouge!

questions.question: Bon Jovi claimed that he wrote the power ballad Bed of Roses while suffering from which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hangover

questions.question: How many Grammy Awards did Mariah Careys power ballad Hero win?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None

questions.question: This New Jersey musician is most famous as the arranger and musical director for Sinatra, Dean Martin, Ella Fitzgerald, Judy Garland, Johnny Mathis and Peggy Lee. Linda Ronstadt had two Platinum albums featuring his arrangements.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nelson Riddle

questions.question: Who wrote the power ballad Woman in Love performed by Barbra Streisand in 1980?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bee Gees

questions.question: This famous guitarist was discovered while in rehab at a Synanon Center.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Pass

questions.question: Eric Clapton wrote and dedicated his power ballad Tears in Heaven to this member of his family who passed away in an accident.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His son

questions.question: Whitney Houstons mother and aunt have both won Grammy Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What RB male musician performed the 1996 power ballad I Believe I Can Fly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: R. Kelly

Little does he know the singer has keyed his 4-wheel drive, carved her name in his leather seats and taken a Louisville slugger to his headlights. What American Idol winner had a hit with Before He Cheats ?

options.text: d the night is so long.

questions.question: This quartet was formed in Mississippi in 1934 during the heart of the Great Depression. In 1954 the group won the Arthur Godfrey talent contest and then just sixteen days later two of the mainstays of the group were killed in a plane crash. Shorlty thereafter J.D. Sumner joined as bass, but it was James Blackwood that kept the group moving forward.
